meanings.sent1: After the trial, the prosecutor decided to reaccuse the suspect of the crime.
meanings.sent2: The detective will reaccuse the suspect if new evidence is found.
meanings.sent3: The lawyer jokingly threatened to reaccuse the witness of stealing his pen.
meanings.sent4: The teacher's stern look seemed to reaccuse the student of cheating.
meanings.sent5: The dark clouds seemed to reaccuse the sky of hiding the sun.

meanings.definition: To bring a new accusation against someone.
meanings.sent1: The rival gang members planned to reaccuse their enemies of trespassing.
meanings.sent2: The politician decided to reaccuse his opponent of corruption during the debate.
meanings.sent3: The kids playfully threatened to reaccuse each other of eating the last cookie.
meanings.sent4: The thunderstorm seemed to reaccuse the lightning of being too loud.
meanings.sent5: The mirror reflection seemed to reaccuse the person of not smiling enough.
